description:
As you know I’m always looking for waterfalls.  Sometimes I don’t have enough time to get out of the city so I decided to check some possible climbing crags and a brook that flows into Cole Harbour.  The climbing crags were a series of waypoints taken on sat imagery.  From my track, the south rocks and path didn’t amount to very much.

There was only little fall that only appears after rain at;   I decided to move north a little and follow a brook of about 2-3 ft in width.  Immediately I was impressed as the forest is super easy to navigate with little underbrush.  The brook looses some elevation towards the harbour and that gives rise to a few cascade type falls.  Just before the brook enters the harbour on the left (facing downstream) is actual a good size wall for bouldering opportunities (44.654, -63.439).
directions: Cole Harbour Rd.  Turn on Bissett Rd going towards Rainbow Heaven beach.  The small brook to follow downstream crosses that road at;  44.651, -63.438.
title: Cole Harbour Cascades and Crag
